example[0]: Water poured through the hole, saturating the carpet.
definition[1]: to put a lot of something into a particular place, especially so that you could not add any more
example[1]: Our culture is saturated with television and advertising.
definition[2]: to mix as much of a solid into a chemical mixture as possible
definition[3]: a type of fat from meat or milk products that is thought to be less healthy than other kinds of fat from vegetables or fish
example[2]: Choose a type of spread thatâ€™s lower in saturates than butter.
definition[4]: to offer so much of a product for sale that there is more than people want to buy
example[3]: A flood of cheap Italian tomatoes has almost saturated the market.
example[4]: Smaller banks are struggling to compete in an already saturated market.
